# intensity

**Instance Property**

The luminous flux, in lumens, or total brightness of the light. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var intensity: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

When working with photometric lights (see the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/iesProfileURL] property) or physically-based rendering (see [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/LightingModel-swift.struct/physicallyBased]), you can leave the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/color] property at its default white color and use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/intensity] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/temperature] to control the light using realistic parameters. When working with physically-based materials, this value the luminous flux of the light source. The default value is `1000` lumens.

When not using physically-based rendering, this value (divided by 1000) serves as a multiplier for the the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/color] property. The default value of of `1000` leaves the light color unmodulated; you can use higher values, for example, to brighten a light whose color is already the maximum red value.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Modifying a Light’s Appearance

- **type**: A constant identifying the general behavior of the light.
- **SCNLight.LightType**: Constants specifying the general behavior of a light, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight/type] property.
- **color**: The color of the light. Animatable.
- **temperature**: The color temperature, in degrees Kelvin, of the light source. Animatable.
- **sphericalHarmonicsCoefficients**: Data describing the estimated lighting environment in all directions for a light probe.
